alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 5:08PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherokee, southern Bradley and Polk Counties through 600 PM EST... At 508 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Etowah to near Cohutta. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Benton, Ducktown, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, William L. Davenport Refuge, Waterville, Violet and Conasauga. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
